name: Conrad Miami

reviews.text: I stayed at the Conrad for 4th July weekend. I was not to happy about my room since it was facing this construction site. I called the front desk a room change was not problem. Furthermore , the front desk staff we always smiling, free internet service, staff perfect, grand bathroom facing the bay. I just want to say thanks to Alex in the staff. I will post some pictures at later date.
reviews.title: Thank You Alex and the Staff
Not for the light sleeper
reviews.text: If you're a light sleeper, this isn't the place for you. The clientele is louder than at the J.W. Marriot or Four Seasons, and the walls are paper thin.

reviews.title: Top Notch
reviews.text: It is the place to stay in downtown Miami (not SoBe)........I stayed there for a week....its a nice location on Brickell with wonderful vistas of Biscayne bay........but this location is true to most of the hotels in this area here including the Intercontinenatal on Bisayne Bay Blvd.......

reviews.title: Don't VALET at CONRAD
reviews.text: This Hotel is class apart in service......I haven't seen more nicely adorned rooms....with an attention to detail like no other in the buisness......and a breathtaking exterior to the building. There is some renovation going on due to the effects of Wilma....but I did not encounter any hassles due to that...............The bed and the quality of the accessories in room top class..........I loved the small study lamps that are attached to the bed. .........

reviews.title: classy without the attitude
reviews.text: The people who service the room show a great attention to your needs and the attention can be seen in the way everything is set up when you return to ur room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed just Friday and Saturday night, as we were in Miami for a weekend wedding. Most everything was very nice. Front desk staff was attentive and helpful when we needed directions, etc. Room was quiet with a nice view towards the ocean, although the hotel is a block away from the water. A bit on the small side, the room was nicely appointed and the bathroom was roomy. I loved the comfy down bedding, the bed was great and we both slept really well. Nightly turn down service with bottled water & chocolate was nice touch.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our weekend in Miami!

likes.disliked: — Downtown business district didn't suit our trip

reviews.title: Worst 5-star hotel in the world
reviews.text: The only meal we ate at the hotel was a private brunch on the rooftop patio Sunday morning, and it was excellent. The ample waitstaff tended to our every need and the buffet was delicious and constantly restocked over the course of the three hours we were there.

reviews.title: You Have to be KIDDING Me!
reviews.text: Location is downtown in business district, not much to do in the area if you are a tourist. Rooftop pool looked ok, we didn't spend any time there because it was very windy while we were there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint was that even though we registered as a wedding guest, we never recieved the gift basket that all wedding guests were supposed to have had delivered to their room. Not sure who's fault it was, we didn't know about the basket until after we checked out.
reviews.title: Not worth the money for vacationers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip: DON'T bother trying to self park, it is a pain and costs the same per day as valet.
reviews.title: Business Traveler or just R&R

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and Service at a good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in town for Art Basel and couldn't get a place in South Beach. Downtown is really a ghost town but it was a nice change from the crush of people in SOBE. We were upgraded to a "residence" basically a suite with a kitchenette. Nice Molton Brown products. Huge marble bath and good light in the rooms.
reviews.title: Average business hotel- Good value

likes.disliked: — Pool is in a odd location 2 elevators to get to your room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did find the living room furniture to be a little IKEAesque but not terrible.
reviews.title: Staff not the friendliest
Avoid the Conrad Miami at all costs!!
reviews.text: This is a business hotel - not a luxury hotel. Not nearly in the class of a Four Seasons or Mandarin Oriental.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff was friendly to us, not especially professional perhaps more training would be in order but none of them had "Miamitude" I would stay there again if I had discount corporate rates.
reviews.title: Gorgeous

likes.disliked: — The lifts - you have to go up to reception, then back down to your room, then across to another building to get to the pool

reviews.text: I went with my husband, who was on a business trip, to this hotel. The location isn't good if you want to be on the water. The hotel had a European feel and the staff wasn't the friendliest.
reviews.title: Helpful Staff, Comfortable & Clean Rooms

reviews.text: I had never stayed at a Conrad before and decided to take the plunge. The room was well appointed and well done. Everything was very comfortable. There was a seperate shower and tub, which is always nice. The views were quite good. The lobby is on the 25th floor and the guest rooms are below, so it takes 2 elevator rides at least to get where you want. While you can self-park, it does not allow for in-out priviledges. Staff was very friendly. While there was work being done to the outside of the building, I never noticed anything.
reviews.title: Beautiful room, too cool for me

reviews.text: You cannot beat the service at the Conrad. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was exceptionally clean and we appreciated the turndown service which provided bottled water and slippers. All the upgraded amenities were a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great Value

likes.liked: — In downtown, so best suited for buisness travel

reviews.text: I agree that the walls are slightly thin. However, no poblem sleeping in the comfortable beds.
reviews.title: price high, service poor

reviews.text: This hotel was about a $20 cab ride from South Beach and Key Biscayne. Breakfast at Atrio was amazing, dinner was just average.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel I have ever stayed in--Bar None!!

reviews.text: I was on a business trip with 2 colleagues in Miami. As the Four Seasons was booked we landed at the Conrad nearby. My 2 colleagues had severe problems checking in as the credit card acceptance did not work. So they had to draw cash and pay the room in advance. Next day it worked, when I checked in. The walls are thin and everything is very loud at night, nothing for people who don´t sleep deeply. The house-keeping is worse than in a 2* hotel. For everything you need you have to call them (sometimes twice) as they do not fill up the bath accessories automatically, only upon request. Ckecking out a problem again, they were not able to provide my colleague a proper invoice because he paid cash (which was their fault). Excuse was: "..we are using the Hilton system which can not handle this.."" Also late check out (only 2 hlours) took me 30min to arrange.
reviews.title: Great way to start off a cruise vacation!

likes.disliked: — Multi Elevators to navigate around the hotel

description: Decidedly modern, boldly conceived, and beautifully designed, this luxury hotel creates a unique sensory experience for its guests. The 203 guest rooms and 103 residence suites were stylishly created with a sophisticated traveler in mind, combining some of the finest services with high-tech facilities. Located in the heart of Miami's vibrant Brickell Avenue district, this sleek, downtown Miami luxury hotel invites you to experience Miami's sense of style and International flair. As the sophisticated dining and entertainment milieu Level 25 elevates the senses, stunning vistas of the city and Biscayne Bay unfold below.
